result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark D Fus Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with huber for work/education/treatment if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; to begin within up to 45 days; defendant to report to MCJ 08/04/15 to make arrangements to begin;  jail may be served in ONEIDA COUNTY if defendant makes arrangements
on any & all vehicles T&R in defendant's name and on defendant himself; IID to be installed within 14 days

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Mark D Fus Jr
Current: 1013 Lincoln St, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2015)
Prior: 1013 Lincoln St Apt 5, Rhinelander, WI 54501

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:35am
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/pro se.  
VR not applicable.

State agrees that it will not charge the accompanying PAC charge - COURT so notes.

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  def is competent to represent self; a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: $1379 inclusive; 5 days MCJ w/huber for work/education/treament if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to begin within up to 45 days, defendant to report to MCJ today to make arrangements to begin, but jail may be served in ONEIDA COUNTY if defendant makes arrangements; 12 month DL rev w/credit;   Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 12 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; AODA and any follow up recommended.  

Adj: 8:44am

Shall not consume alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 5 business days.
